message: I'm having a network problem that I can't seem to fix.
I can't connect to my LAN or WAN, I keep getting the error "Unidentified network".
Reinstalling the NIC
And so on.
Currently I have automatic IP configuration set
All other computers on the network seem to be working.
@jarod73 Yes, several times - same thing happens "Unidentified network"
Aha - when I tried running /release and /renew again I got some new information
and I've got a D-Link DIR-655 as a router.
I've tried IP releasing, flushing the DNS cache
Now I'm trying to use manual IP configuration but I don't know how to determine the dynamic IP that my router would provide my box.
so i take it you did ipconfig /release then /renew
Anyone know?
is it wired or wireless?
wired
DHCP is enabled by the way.
try opening a cmd.exe window with admin rights and type ROUTE DELETE 0.0.0.0 and reboot.
have you checked for viruses/malware? tried uninstalling drivers rebooting then reinstalling? also replug the network cables they may be loose
@jarod73 Tried it all three, no success.
@ant Doesn't work "Could not remove route: Element did not exist." or similar
did you try uninstalling then reinstalling tcpip?
Yepp
did the network toubleshooter not find the problem?
Says the IP configuration is wrong - but it's set to automatic
Do you have IPV6 enabled?
can you post the results of ipconfig /all here?
IPv6 is enabled when it reinstalls the NIC, but I turned it off in a previous attempt to see if that was the problem. @jarod73 Sure, two minutes!
@ant I meant*
There's the ipconfig /all
another thing to try is to boot into safe mode with networking and see if it works then
have you tried disabling the lan connection the re-enabling it?
Though, my ipconfig is in Swedish - I take it you'll be able to understand it nonetheless?
and for /renew: "An error appeared when the interface connection to local network tried to renew: Could not connect to the DHCP server. Request timed out."
http://pastie.org/1639338
i keep thinking hardward problem

Try booting into safe mode with networking and do an ipconfig /all there. I'm willing to bet your network access will be restored there. If that's the case then, one of those virtual NICs is causing the problem.
For /release: "An error appeared when the interfaces connection to local network was released: An address has not yet been asssociated with the network node."
It shouldn't be too difficult to grok, try posting it. We're just looking for clues.
Or VMWare actually..
*nodnods* I'll give it a shot!
Two weeks ago
The fact that situation remains the same in safe mode would seem to indicate a hardware problem.
Just noticed that the standard gateway have not been specified..
You have some strange tunneling adapters listed after the ethernet one. I'm guessing those are part of the problem. The NIC isn't attached to a network hence the 169.x.x.x address.
@ant Those are VirtualBox adapters I think
It wasn't instant
np!
so the network connection started going out then just stopped?
Happened sequently over three times. First it worked with just reactivating the NIC, then reinstalling then it just suddenly stopped.
yes
more or less.
it could be software hmm
have you tried a different network cable?
I'll report the progress in a few.
@ant I get the same error. :(
Same ipconfig /all as well.
when did it start happening?
Try a different NIC/
it's like it knows a network is there but cannot communicate with it
i agree
I'll see if I can scavange some adapter from an old computer.
Thanks!
It works! Apparently I had a VPN connection that was mupping about. Thought I had removed it but apparently not. Thanks a lot for everyone's help!
turn off you computer and unplug the power to the router for a minute, plug back in and turn on your computer.  see if that helps
